result.execSummary:
The defendant Grace N Riedlinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.d  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Participate in sex offender treatment assessment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 30 days in the county jail, commencing 9/24/16 @ 8am.  Huber privileges granted for employment, work crew, and schooling.  Perform 100 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No use of social media websites and/or applications.  No contact with vulnerable populations without permission of agent.  Not to possess video recording device without agent's permission.  Participate in the creation of a realistic case plan and any programming related to the associated goals and identified criminogenic needs.  Write an apology letter to victim and submit to agent.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges are allowed for employment, work crew, and schooling.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Larry Keating.  Probation Agent Brittany Spencer in court.  Clerk: PT
Argument heard on DE's motion to allow DE to reside in the home of her parents where there is Internet.  Both the State and Agent Spencer have no objection as long as the Internet is password protected from the DE.  Upon hearing statements court grants DE's motion and Internet shall be password protected by the parents and no use of social media.
NMM to Modify/Clarify Sentence mailed to Brittany Spencer

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Grace N Riedlinger, appeared with Attorney Loren James Keating.  Clerk: PT
Motion is adjourned so Atty Keating can provide notice to the probation agent.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.
in Support of Motion to Modify/Clarify Sentence filed by Atty Keating
to Modify/Clarify Sentence filed by Atty Keating
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Grace N Riedlinger, appeared with Attorney Loren James Keating.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with Conditions.   As a condition court imposes 30 days in the KCJ commencing on 9/24/16 at 8:00 AM. Huber authorized for employment, work crew and schooling.   DE is also ordered to complete 100 hours of Community Service.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court cost and surcharge ordered and to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.
From Atty. Keating to Judge Kerkman
received from Atty Keating w/ attachments
Fox 6 requesting permission to bring camera into sentencing hearing

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Grace N Riedlinger, appeared with Attorney Loren James Keating.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Grace N Riedlinger, appeared with Attorney Loren James Keating.  Clerk: PT
Atty Keating states case will be resolved and requests another date for a plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 10:20 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Grace N Riedlinger, appeared with Attorney Loren James Keating.  Clerk: PT
Atty Keating requests an adjournment for further negotation with the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 09:20 am.
Final pre-trial on May 3, 2016 at 10:50 am and confirmed with Atty Keating's Office
Due to a continued jury trial; FPT rescheduled to 5/3/16 at 10:50 AM pending confirmation from Atty Keating.
filed by Atty. Loren Keating  kmk

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Grace N Riedlinger, appeared with Attorney Loren James Keating.  Clerk: PT
Atty Keating states he just received discovery and still needs to review the video in question, which has not been made available to him yet.  Atty Trigg states she will make arrangements this afternoon.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: To Preliminary Hearing

Defendant, Grace N Riedlinger, appeared with Attorney Loren James Keating.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Atty Loren Keating has been retained by DE; Atty Celebre consents to the substitution; Court dismisses Atty Celebre.   DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over. DE files request for substitution of Br 3; tab pulled for Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 09:10 am.
